subject: Re: [junit] Running same tests again with different configuration..
msgSnippet: ... The API/SPI model cries out for Contract Tests , which we used to call Abstract Test Cases . Google Abstract Test Cases for more information and an
messageBody:
Arun J wrote:
> Folks,
> Sorry for absconding for some time..problem of being in a different
> timezone..
>
> Trying to elaborate my problem stmt as it lead to different interpretation:
> I have an API that needs to be tested. My tests are written for that
> API. Now this is an API/SPI model. Hence multiple implementation are
> made available for the SPI. So what I wanted to do is to run the same
> set of tests on the same API but flipping the underlying SPI
> Implementation. I wanted my test results to reflect this for
> different SPI implementation.

The API/SPI model cries out for "Contract Tests", which we used to call
"Abstract Test Cases". Google "Abstract Test Cases" for more information
and an example or two.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
